data.title: TerrainFX profiles do not bind to internal name but to the base texture name
data.body:
If you want to use TerrainFX profiles by creating a "singleton Material(TerrainFX_sand)" for you terrain material the "MapTo" command does not target the internal name of the TerrainMaterial but the name of the diffuse or base texture.
This may or not be an issue, but it is confusing.
It looks like terrain materials are not materials and so have no material name, and since they have no material name, the engine looks for the name of the diffuse/basetexture (first texture you add), so the "MapTo" command has to point to this one instead of the internal material name as it is used with other materials.

data.title: Weapon reload animation stuck
data.body:
Sometimes when you reload your weapon (Ryder and Lurker) the animation gets stuck and does not play properly, the reloading process itself works, you just cannot see it properly without animation. This issue happens mostly, if you play as client, as server it is not likely to reproduce this error, but it happens very often with playing client,
I have the suspicion that the animation blending produces this problem when it tries to blend other animations while reloading.

data.title: winTime month fix

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). data.body: Windows SYSTEMTIME stores month 1-12 while T3D LocalTime stores month 0-11. This obviously causes problems with GetDateFormat used in the function Platform::localTimeToString( const LocalTime &lt ) in winTime.cpp. Especially in December ;-)

data.title: Triggers not working correctly
data.body:
This issue is on 3.6.X - The Triggers WORK on the Master Branch.

Triggers don't work once u save, exit a level (just back to the Option screen - dont need to go all the way out) and go back in.

What I did to test - 
in the trigger.cs
Add an echo to all the Default Trigger functions.

Start the level, add a trigger and give it the Default Trigger Datablock. If U walk through now, youll get the echos. Save and exit the level. Go back in and walk through the trigger. NO echos. 

Now if u add ANOTHER trigger in a new place, give it the Default trigger Datablock and walk through it, youll get the echos for THAT trigger, but NOT the first one.

data.title: Waterplane horizon glitch at high altitude
data.body:
to reproduce this:
add waterplane to your level, move camera up and look at the horizon. You will see something like this:
![screenshot_001-00000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9847430/5462349/4249e64a-8573-11e4-863b-11cd70cdd1a2.png)

if you move around the camera you will see it "flicker" and is quite annoying.

I found that changing IN.horizonFactor.x to 0.0 here: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/shaders/common/water/waterV.hlsl#L96
will give this result:
![screenshot_001-00001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9847430/5462383/98ba951a-8573-11e4-8265-8c0a9f2ad5d5.png)

The change will not render anymore the "upper side" of the waterplane but is also stopping the "flickering".

data.title: Invalid if Statement in GuiCanvas::paint()
data.body:
Just came across this in guiCanvas.cpp:

[ // inhibit explicit refreshes in the case we're swapped out
if( mPlatformWindow && mPlatformWindow->isVisible() && GFX->allowRender())
mPlatformWindow->displayEvent.trigger(mPlatformWindow->getWindowId());](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gui/core/guiCanvas.cpp#L1520)

Either there should be a separate if statement of "if (mPlatformWindow)" before that one or it should be removed entirely if the check isn't actually needed.

data.title: Cannot bring dts models into the scene editor.
data.body:
Recently I noticed that you only can load and place models in your scene if they are in .dae format, if you place .dts files in your art/shapes/\* folder they do not appear in the editor to be placed.
This may be a feature wanted by people who do not want to keep the .dae source files in the game all the time for people to be able it to place them in the editor. I tried to deleted some .dae files because they have big file size and serve no purpose.

data.body:
Fixes issue #145

As per the solution in the thread http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/130955

While The behavior was apparently difficult to replicate in a local multiplay, I was able to reliably replicate it on LAN. Adding the fix made it behave reliably.

data.title: Fixes #945
data.body: Fixes #945

data.title: custom precipitation textures mostly render as white squares or very bright
data.body:
I just tried out Ron's asset packs and he also added some custom datablocks for precipitation with custom textures, but they all render as white squares.
Tried also with my own custom textures for precipitation, same problem, they are all too bright and transparency renders wrong.
My suspicion is, that the render mode is wrong somehow, like the transparency method. When I made a testimage I was able to make it work by making it like 95% transparent and reduce brightness by like 400%, the image in the image editor is almost not visible this way, so I guess it is not supposed to be like that.

data.title: Hide precipiation object crashes Torque
data.body: If you place a precipiation object in your mission, like rain and then try to hide it, so that it does not render anymore, Torque crashes completely.

data.title: levelinfo fog color does not save
data.body: If you change the color of the fog in the levelinfo object and you close and reload the level the fog color is reset to the default. The color data you chose is still stored in the datablock, but it does not get loaded when you load the level, only if you open the editor and touch the value again.

data.title: mission.postfxpreset.cs file not loaded when not in levels root folder
data.body:
If you setup a postfxpreset file for your mission file it only works when it is placed in the levels root folder, while all other files the mission needs also work from a subfolder like levels/mission1/mission1.mis
So if you move your posftpreset script file also to your subfolder where your mission file is, it does not get loaded.
